Home → Branches → Halesworth Library

Halesworth Library

Manager: Ali Hopkins

Bridge Street, Halesworth
IP19 8AD

Tel: 01986 875095
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Halesworth County Library
Social media: Facebook Twitter

Facilities

  • Free wifi available
  • Scanning, printing and photocopying facilities
  • Accessibility information
Room hire

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 0930 – 1200
Tuesday 0930 – 1730
Wednesday 0930 – 1730
Thursday Closed
Friday 0930 – 1800
Saturday 0930 – 1700
Sunday 1000 – 1500

Regular events and activities

Event Days Times
Register births and deaths: to book an appointment call Lowestoft Registration office on 01502 528160 first and third Tuesday of the month N/a
Mindful colouring: held in the gallery in the library second and fourth Tuesday of the month 1400-1600
Lego club: £2 per builder Sunday every 2 weeks 1000-1100
Knit and Natter, Stitch and Chatter group: support for your craft projects first and third Tuesday of the month 1400-1600
Junior Wordsmiths young writers’ group for 8-13 year olds: £15 per 5 sessions – book in advance Friday every 2 weeks 1600-1730
Fitness classes: gentle mobility and stretches – full instruction given by qualified Physical Activity Instructor Sue Potter – book in advance Thursday 0930-1030, 1100-1200
Creative writing group: run by local writer/publisher Tom Corbett. Book in advance – call 07831 364021 Monday 1030-1200
County councillor surgery second Saturday of the month 1000-1100
Careers advice: contact library for more details and book in advance Arranged on a mutually convenient basis N/a
Board games afternoon: donation to Library Friends £1.50 (includes a raffle ticket and refreshments) first Monday of the month 1330-1600
Baby Bounce and Tot Rock: songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers Tuesday 1000-1100
Craft activities: for primary school age children Sunday 1200-1430
Laptop training sessions for beginners: book in advance (£5 per session) Wednesday 1400-1500
iPad training sessions for beginners: book in advance (£5 per session) Wednesday 1515-1615
Age UK: providing free help advice and information first and last Wednesday of the month 1030-1200
Top Time: events and activities for older people Wednesday 1030-1200
Reading group third Thursday of the month 1930-2100
Book Wizards: for 7-13 year olds, bring your favourite book – book in advance Sunday once a month 1130-1230
